As of May 2005, 124 areas with a total population of 159 million people were required to develop State Implementation Plans (SIPs) under the Clean Air Act to reach air quality standards. Federal agencies are prohibited from funding projects in these areas unless they conform to the SIPs, ensuring they do not worsen air quality or delay attainment of standards.
